thread.title: The Dow Is Going Nowhere--And That's Ominous
thread.title_full: The Dow Is Going Nowhere--And That's Ominous - Forbes

author: Clem Chambers
title: The Dow Is Going Nowhere--And That's Ominous
text:
It’s the summer. We should be in a seasonal bear market. ‘Sell in May’ exists for a reason, summer is normally prone for a sharp slump. As such it seems a bit obvious to warn of a nasty dip.
However, when prices are high dips can be even worse than usual.
A lot of grumpy old men are very uncomfortable with current high stock prices and many look to a rise in interest rates to spark a correction or crash.
I feel we could crash or bubble. I do not think a normal market of neatly rising stocks is the most likely path. I’m risk off but not as deeply in cash as in the past. I don’t have the temperament to sit on the sidelines and wait for the end of the world. I prefer to play the bigger fool game for now.
However, the Dow is in a bad place technically. It is clearly stuck. Since March the market has been bogged down and going nowhere. Rest is not an option for markets. They go up or down or thrash around, they don’t go to sleep. As such this congestion is ominous.
It’s the same at the S&P 500:
